info.title: Baculum API
info.description: This is the Baculum API documentation.

Device.name: device
Device.description: Storage device (can be used instead drive)

ComponentType.name: component_type
ComponentType.description: Component type: dir, sd, fd or bcons

ApplyJobDefs.name: apply_jobdefs
ApplyJobDefs.description: Apply JobDefs in results (this parameter is taken into account only for Job resources)

get.description: Get client list.
Get client by specific Client identifier.
Get 'show clients' bconsole command output for specific client

maxjobs.description: Maximum Concurrent Jobs value for client

get.description: Get client status for specific client

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Output type using together with output=json parameter.

get.description: Get jobs done by specific client
Get list Client files/directories for specific path

put.description: Set Client bandwidth limit in bytes

get.description: Get 'show clients' bconsole command output
Get job list.
Get job by specific Job identifier.

delete.description: Delete job by specific Job identifier.

items.description: Console output from removing specific jobid

get.description: Get 'show jobs' bconsole command output for specific job

put.description: Set Job bandwidth limit in bytes

get.description: Get job file and directory list.
Get job list by file criteria.

200.description: Show job list by file criteria

jobstatus.description: Job status. Note, some statuses can be not visible outside (used internally by Bacula)

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Filename to find jobs containing the file. Normally it searches for files which have given 'filename' in name, like \*filename\*. If strict mode is used then is done equal matching filename == name.

parameters.name: strict
parameters.description: Enables strict file matching filename == name

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to narrow down the results to files from one specific path. The path must be finished with a slash.

get.description: Get job resource names (after applying console ACL)

get.summary: Get most recent jobids for job to restore
get.description: Useful for restore. Determines all single jobids required to restore job given in jobname. Besides jobname there are required only two parameters (client OR clientid) AND (fileset OR filesetid)

items.description: List job identifiers to restore job given as jobname

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: Client name (can be used instead clientid)

parameters.name: fileset
parameters.description: FileSet name (can be used instead filesetid)

get.description: Get estimate output by output identifier

parameters.name: out_id
parameters.description: Output identifier acquired during estimate start.

post.description: Estimate job bytes and files before real job run. There can be used (id OR name) and (clientid OR client)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Job name (can be used instead id)

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: Client name (can be used instead clientid)

post.description: Run job with specific parameters. There can be used (id OR name) and (clientid OR client)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Job name (can be used instead id)

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: Client name (can be used instead clientid)

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: Storage name (can be used instead storageid)

parameters.name: pool
parameters.description: Pool name (can be used instead poolid)

parameters.name: fileset
parameters.description: FileSet name (can be used instead filesetid)

get.description: Get 'show jobs' bconsole command output

get.summary: Show job total bytes and files
get.description: Get total number backed up bytes and files from all jobs. It works also with Console ACL.

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: Client name (can be used instead clientid)

parameters.name: fileset
parameters.description: FileSet (can be used instead of filesetid) (for full restore)

get.description: Get storage list.
Get storage by specific Storage identifier.
Get 'show storages' bconsole command output for specific storage
Get storage status for specific storage

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Output type using together with output=json parameter.

get.description: Mount storage
Umount storage
Release storage
Get 'show storages' bconsole command output
Get pool list.

Get all volumes in specific pool
Get 'show pools' bconsole command output for specific pool

put.summary: Update properties all volumes in pool
put.description: Update properties all volumes in specific pool

200.description: Update all volumes in pool output

get.description: Get 'show pools' bconsole command output
Get volume list.
Get volume by specific Volume/Media identifier.

parameters.name: poolid
parameters.description: Update Volume Pool by Pool identifier

delete.description: Delete volume from the Catalog by specific Volume/Media identifier.

get.description: Get jobs done on volume

get.summary: Get volumes required to restore file
get.description: Get volumes required to restore a file from a job

200.description: Volumes list to restore a file

get.description: Get label volume output by output identifier

parameters.name: out_id
parameters.description: Output identifier acquired during label start.

post.description: Label volume with specified name (without using barcode).

200.description: Label volume with specified name (without barcode)

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: Storage name can be used instead of storageid

parameters.name: pool
parameters.description: Pool name can be used instead of poolid

get.description: Get label barcodes volume output by output identifier

parameters.name: out_id
parameters.description: Output identifier acquired during label start.

post.description: Label volume with specified name (with using barcode).

parameters.name: storage
parameters.description: Storage name can be used instead of storageid

parameters.name: pool
parameters.description: Pool name can be used instead of poolid

get.description: Get fileset list.
Get FileSet by specific FileSet identifier.
Get FileSet resource names (after applying console ACL)
Get Schedule resource names (after applying console ACL)
Get Schedule status

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Schedule results limit. Setting zero disables the limit. Default value is taken into account only if the days parameter is not set.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Schedule start time to show (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM::SS)

put.description: Update BVFS cache for specific jobs identifiers

get.description: BVFS list directories

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to list (used instead of pathid parameter)

parameters.name: pathid
parameters.description: Path identifier to list path (used instead of path parameter)

get.description: BVFS list files

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to list (used instead of pathid parameter)

parameters.name: pathid
parameters.description: Path identifier to list path (used instead of path parameter)

get.description: BVFS list file versions

parameters.name: clientid
parameters.description: Client identifier (can be used instead of client value)

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: Client name (can be used instead clientid)

parameters.name: copies
parameters.description: If set to 1, lists copy job file versions together with backup job file versions

get.summary: BVFS get particular jobids to restore
get.description: BVFS get particular jobids to restore job with given jobid

200.description: Console output with list job identifiers

get.description: Get job log for jobid
Get messages log. Note, because there are returned all current Bacula messages, this endpoint should not be shared non-admin users.
Get director status

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Output type using together with output=json parameter.

get.description: Get OAuth2 client account list.
Get specific OAuth2 client account config

parameters.name: console
parameters.description: Director Console name to create dedicated bconsole.conf that is assigned to account. Parameter must be used together with 'director' parameter.

parameters.name: director
parameters.description: Director Name to create dedicated bconsole.conf that is assigned to account. Parameter must be used together with 'console' parameter.

parameters.description: Director Console name to create dedicated bconsole.conf that is assigned to account. Parameter must be used together with 'director' parameter.

parameters.name: director

autoprune.description: Determines if automatic prunning is enabled/disabled

job.description: Job name with date and time

jobstatus.description: Job status. Note, some statuses can be not visible outside (used internally by Bacula)

hasbase.description: Has base jobs, 1 if job uses base job, otherwise 0

hascache.description: Has Bvfs cache, 1 if job has Bvfs cache, otherwise 0

autochanger.description: Determines if storage is autochanger type. 1 if it is autochanger, otherwise 0

maxvoljobs.description: Maximum number of jobs on volume

maxvolfiles.description: Maximum number of files on volume

maxvolbytes.description: Maximum number of bytes on volume

recycle.description: If set to 1 it enables volume recycling

actiononpurge.description: Action on purge to do on volumes

pooltype.description: Pool type. Currently is possible to set only one value: 'Backup'

enabled.description: Determines if volume is enabled or not

firstwritten.description: Date and time first write to volume

lastwritten.description: Date and time last write to volume

voljobs.description: Number of jobs written on volume

volfiles.description: Number of files written on volume

volblocks.description: Number of blocks written on volume

volbytes.description: Number of bytes written on volume

enabled.description: Determines if volume is enabled or not

recycle.description: If set to 1 it enables volume recycling

actiononpurge.description: Action on purge to do on volumes

state.description: Element state: E - empty, F - full

lastwritten.description: Date and time last write to volume

volbytes.description: Number of bytes written on volume

state.description: Element state: E - empty, F - full

lastwritten.description: Date and time last write to volume

volbytes.description: Number of bytes written on volume
